sen.j: 紀家子（きのいえこ、生没年不詳）は、平安時代後期の女官。
sen.e: KI no Ieko (date of birth and death unknown) was a court lady in the late Heian period.
KI no Ieko (dates of birth and death unknown) was a court lady in the late Heian period.
KI no Ieko (dates of birth and death unknown) was a court lady in the late Heian period.
She was Kyujin (court lady) of Emperor Toba.
She was Kyujin (court lady) of Emperor Toba.
She was a court lady of Emperor Toba.
sen.cmt: 用語の日本語は不用とか考え策状しました。（）削除しました。a補足しました。

sen.j: 紀氏の出身で、父は石清水八幡宮別当光清。
sen.e: She was from Ki clan and her father was Kosei, Iwashimizu Hachimangu betto (superintendant of the Iwashimizu Hachiman-gu Shrine).
She was from the Ki clan and her father was Kosei, Iwashimizu Hachimangu betto (superintendant of the Iwashimizu Hachiman-gu Shrine).
She was from the Ki clan and her father was Kosei, Iwashimizu Hachimangu betto (superintendant of the Iwashimizu Hachiman-gu Shrine).
Her mother was the daughter of Kakushin (Hogen).
Her mother was the daughter of Kakushin (Hogen).
Her mother was the daughter of Kakushin (Hogen).

sen.j: 歌人の小侍従は異母妹。
sen.e: Kojijyu, a kajin (waka poet) was her half sister.
Kojijyu, a kajin (waka poet), was her half sister.
Kojiju, a kajin (waka poet), was her half sister.

sen.j: 初め待賢門院藤原璋子（鳥羽天皇中宮）の女房で、美濃局と称した。
sen.e: Initially, she was the wife of Taikenmonin FUJIWARA no Shoshi (the Empress of Emperor Toba) and was referred to Mino no Tsubone.
Initially, she was the wife of Taikenmonin FUJIWARA no Shoshi (the Empress of Emperor Toba) and was called to Mino no Tsubone.
Initially, she was the wife of Taikenmonin FUJIWARA no Shoshi (the Empress of Emperor Toba) and was called to Mino no Tsubone.

sen.j: やがて鳥羽天皇に寵愛されて道恵法親王・覚快法親王・阿夜御前の2皇子1皇女の母となった。
sen.e: Then, she became the favorite of Emperor Toba and had two princes and one princess, Cloistered Imperial Prince Doe, Cloistered Imperial Prince Kakukai and Aya Gozen.
Then, she became the favorite of Emperor Toba and had two princes and one princess, Cloistered Imperial Prince Doe, Cloistered Imperial Prince Kakukai and Aya Gozen.
Then, she became the favorite of Emperor Toba and had two princes and one princess, Cloistered Imperial Prince Doe, Cloistered Imperial Prince Kakukai and Aya Gozen.

sen.j: その後、後宮を退いて中納言源師長の妻になったらしい。
sen.e: Subsequently, she was said to resign a consort of the emperor and become the wife of MINAMOTO no Moronaga, Chunagon (councilors ranking).
It is thought that she subsequently gave up the position of consort to the emperor and become the wife of MINAMOTO no Moronaga, Chunagon (councilors ranking).
It is thought that she subsequently gave up the position of consort to the Emperor and become the wife of MINAMOTO no Moronaga, Chunagon (vice-councilor of state).
sen.cmt: Emperor大文字にしました。中納言 = Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) 用語統一リストより訂正しました。
